Filter Wonde raw data

Source: R/filtering_wonde_data.R
filter_WondeData.Rd

Restricts raw Wonde data to only those students, teachers, and classes that meet user-defined filtering criteria such as year group or subject. Designed to generalise across both primary and secondary school datasets.

Usage

filter_WondeData(
  WondeData,
  student_filter = NULL,
  subject_filter = NULL,
  year_fallback_column = "year.data.code",
  fallback_codes = NULL,
  verbose = TRUE
)

Arguments

WondeData

A list of raw Wonde data, where each element represents a single school's extracted dataset from Wonde.

student_filter

Optional function applied to the `education_details` element of each school list, returning the student IDs to keep. The function should return a character vector of IDs.

subject_filter

Optional function applied to the `subjects` element of each school list, returning either a logical vector or IDs to keep. Use this to retain data for specific subjects, such as Mathematics.

year_fallback_column

A character string naming the column in the `student` data that contains year or code information. Used to identify students when `education_details` IDs do not match. Defaults to `"year.data.code"`.

fallback_codes

Optional character vector of values used for matching in `year_fallback_column` when no students are returned by `student_filter`. For example, `c("R", "Reception")`.

verbose

Logical; if `TRUE`, displays progress messages while filtering.

Value

A list of filtered Wonde data objects. Each element will contain only the relevant students, teachers, and classes. The returned list also includes an attribute named `"issue_list"`, which records any schools where fallback rules were applied.
